definition: Zhao Gou, personal name of the tenth Song Emperor Gaozong 高宗[Gao1 zong1]
to surpass (old)
surname Zhao/one of the seven states during the Warring States Period (476-220 BC)/the Former Zhao 前趙 (304-329) and Later Zhao 後趙 (319-350), states of the Sixteen Kingdoms
to construct/to form/to make up/to compose/literary composition/paper mulberry (Broussonetia papyrifera)
variant of 構|构[gou4]/(Tw) (coll.) variant of 夠|够[gou4]/to reach by stretching

sentences.english: Qin Hui family was free, Zhao Gou is still doing his emperor.
sentences.chinese: 秦桧一家都被免官，赵构仍在做他的皇帝。

definition: Qin Hui (1090-1155 AD), Song Dynasty official said to have betrayed General Yue Fei 岳飛|岳飞[Yue4 Fei1]
Gaozong Emperor, Temple name of the tenth Song Emperor Zhao Gou 趙構|赵构[Zhao4 Gou4] (1107-1187 AD), reigned (1127-1162 AD)
Yue Fei (1103-1142), Song dynasty patriot and general
Emperor Taizu of Song, posthumous title of the founding Song emperor Zhao Kuangyin 趙匡胤|赵匡胤 (927-976), reigned from 960
Zhao Kuangyin, personal name of founding Song emperor Song Taizu 宋太祖 (927-976)
Emperor Huizong (Song Dynasty)
Khubilai Khan (1215-1294), grandson of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗, first Yuan dynasty emperor, reigned 1260-1294
Zhu Di, personal name of third Ming Emperor Yongle 永樂|永乐[Yong3 le4]
Emperor Ningzong of Southern Song (1168-1224)
Wang Qinruo (962-1025), Northern Song dynasty official
Jin Dynasty (1115-1234), founded by the Jurchen 女真[Nu:3 zhen1] people of North China, a precursor of the Mongol Yuan Dynasty
Yingzong, Temple name of sixth and eighth Ming emperor Zhengtong 正統|正统[Zheng4 tong3]
Kou Zhun (961-1023), Northern Song politician and poet
Yollig Taxin or Yelü Dashi (1087-1143), Chinese-educated Khitan leader, founder of Western Liao 西遼|西辽 in Central Asia
Song dynasty (960-1279)/used to distinguish it from 劉宋|刘宋 Song of Southern dynasties (420-479)
Zhu Yuanwen, personal name of second Ming Emperor Jianwen 建文[Jian4 Wen2]
